item.title: Mounds of rubbish and food waste dumped, 10th September
item.description:
This has already been reported on Friday last week and nothing has been done about it. The query was left open and it has got worse over the weekend. It has been like this for over two weeks now. Please can someone treat this as a matter of urgency? There is huge mounds of rubbish and food waste dumped on Commercial Way, it has been flytipped to such an extent that there is even no longer room for the bin reserved for the building for the residents of 169 Sumner Road . The area is not only unsightly, but a serious health hazard, as much of what has been dumped is food waste.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 103, Commercial Way, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown bushes along the boundary of the Library and 18 Beckenham Road, 10th September
item.description:
Within the grounds of Beckenham Library, the eastern boundary with 18 Beckenham Road (Total Orthodontics) is overgrown with shrubs, bushes and weeds. The Dental practice require an air conditioning servicing, but the engineers cannot access the condensers due to overgrown bushes obstructing the area. Please can the area be cleared so that the engineers can complete their service?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Beckenham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin waste not being collected, 10th September
item.description:
Every few days as is required no one from the council is coming to empty the bins outside the nature park which over the weekends overflow with trash and dog poo and people are not only getting exposed to hazardous substances but this is also a really major threat to the wildlife inside the nature reserve - are you at the council? Just need to simply organise someone to come by every day or two and empty the bins it is so simple please please sort it out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benhill Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree maintenance, 10th September
item.description:
Newly planted tree opposite 35 Clarendon Way. The tree tie has rotted and broken away. So the tree, needing support, is leaning towards the road and seems vulnerable. I think a new tie would help straighten it and give it the support it needs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30A, Clarendon Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
